title: Riginac111
author: Riginac111
content: The journey of bitcointalk is a journey of gradual process, when you look around you will see that may has registered in the bitcointalk and their are unable to achieve any milestone in bitcointalk because of challenges, I thank almighty for me to reach members rank after all challenges I faced both sickness and losing my phone, the one of losing my phone is the one that  would have discouraged me mostly from bitcointalk, but I insisted and continued using my sisters phone to login my account in forum Today I'm a member and I'm excited to see myself to this rank, I will stand to celebrate another milestone in the forum which I know very well,  so when I looked at my ranked up I get more courage, I want to everyone to not lose hope in what they are doing, because their is some things that will stand as obstacles when you want to know what you don't I stand in this precious time to congratulate myself for achieving my first milestone despite that theirs many milestones to achieve but at least I have counted 1 and others shall be achieve later

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Congratulations on your achievement, but just so you know we have a dedicated thread for posts like this;  Announce your rank up, merit or any achievements that makes you feel great so you could have made your post there. Another thing, I think this thread fits well in the reputation board so just move the thread there.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: OP your  new rank achievement celebration is worth it but you're just taking it on the wrong board, Meta board has to do with anything about the forum while reputation has to do so with mostly things that concerns us, our personal behaviours, achievement and reputation as the board says, to make things in an orderly manners was what birth to the unique thread that @Cantsay shared where members can ehare their ranking up celebration messages.Before it use to be on Beginners and help board or any other board and users randomly post by creating their own thread, now everything is being posted under a single thread on reputation as the link giving above says, anyways, congratulations on your new rank.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Congratulations OP on ranking up! I can relate to your happiness as I was in that same position when I ranked up to Member and then Full Member. Keep on doing what you have been doing and in a couple of months you will become a Full Member and you can again celebrate your accomplishment. For now,  you should move this topic to the Reputation board as this board is to discuss the forum and not about personal accomplishment. I can see both Cantsay and 348Judah have already advised you about it. I am the third one on your thread informing you of the same, it won't look good if others after me advise you about the same thing.

comments.author: AprilioMP
comments.body: Time will always be valuable in every opportunity we go through. Time is valuable if we are busy with work that brings us to a gradual process of progress from day to day.Imagine how we lose because we don't make good use of our time to make ourselves better in setting the targets we want to achieve.The word late and various incidents often become reasons that fill a person's thoughts to limit themselves from continuing with the targets they want to achieve. They forget even though time keeps turning and never stops.OP. Congratulations on your achievement. I have a long-term target and will not stop even though in the process I experience difficulties in achieving it.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: If you are not determined, you can't achieve anything but I still believe that things can still go on without us always announcing out achievements though. Don't get me wrong as I also enjoy raising a glass to one or two celebrations but i don't think the earth will stand still if we stopped creating threads for every rank we get to because tbh the forum's not like a competition that requires we announce everything. Congratulations by the way. Consistency is the key

comments.author: Nheer
comments.body: Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMThe journey of bitcointalk is a journey of gradual process, when you look around you will see that may has registered in the bitcointalk and their are unable to achieve any milestone in bitcointalk because of challenges, I thank almighty for me to reach members rank after all challenges I faced both sickness and losing my phone, the one of losing my phone is the one that  would have discouraged me mostly from bitcointalk, but I insisted and continued using my sisters phone to login my account in forum It’s good achievement for you OP and just as you mentioned it’s a gradual process something so gradually you will achieve greater heights in the forum as you wish but the most important thing is not just moving up the ranks but also put all you have learned into good use here on the forum and you should let your knowledge speak for you here and not be the type that has a high rank profile with the knowledge of a member rank.  Challenges faced are what make us strong and want to keep fighting in order to achieve our goals and it’s the same spirit here, I seriously congratulate you on your latest achievement i hope you won’t let it get into your head and feel relaxed. Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMToday I'm a member and I'm excited to see myself to this rank, I will stand to celebrate another milestone in the forum which I know very well,  so when I looked at my ranked up I get more courage, I want to everyone to not lose hope in what they are doing, because their is some things that will stand as obstacles when you want to know what you don't Earning merits and unlocking new activities is not everything in this forum, your contributions is all that matters so I would ask you, if you eventually achieve the highest rank here which I believe is your goal here so what’s next? What will you be doing in the forum, how will you feel when you finally achieve your goal. If you still have challenges of identifying the best suited board for a post by this time then you still have a long way to go. As others mentioned, please move this thread to the Reputation board it is best suited there.

achieve this milestone of member rank, you have more than the merit needed to even qualify for your current rank, it shows that you are doing great.You should also know that because some people are unable to rank up doesn't mean they are finding it challenging, some people joined the forum to ask questions and when they get their answer, they don't bother to impress anyone about anything related to Bitcoin posts, some are traders that prefer to have a strong reputation to trade than for them to have big ranks in the forum, I believe you have seen a junior member in some particular board with new rank, and I hope to see you refer back to this thread in some years when you reach Legendary rank. Cheers!!

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: First of all I congratulate you on achieving member rank because only few people can achieve that rank as it's a difficult thing to get merits without putting a lot effort on your posts. I hope that you'll continue improving yourself and also your posts so that you may rank to even higher rank levels in future.secondly, I recommend you to be careful when logging in your account on someone else's phone because you really don't know if that phone is compromised or not and you also don't know that if that who else can access that phone. The privacy of your account is very important and for that reason I recommend you to only use your account on your own up-to-date devices so you can safely rank up without worrying about being hacked.Finally, I believe that it's a really celebrating worthy thing to share your ranked up journey with other members so they can get inspired from such stories. I know it's hard to rank up in this forum for new members but if you are someone who believes in hard work and gives proper time to this forum then ranking up isn't an issue.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMToday I'm a member and I'm excited to see myself to this rank, I will stand to celebrate another milestone in the forum which I know very well,  so when I looked at my ranked up I get more courage, I want to everyone to not lose hope in what they are doing, because their is some things that will stand as obstacles when you want to know what you don't  It’s been a while I saw one of these.Isn’t there a dedicated thread for this sort of post?Perhaps you didn’t know but, I think it would have been a more wise choice to site your post there as a comment instead of creating yet another thread.Still, I’ll say your post is rather an encouraging one to the lost out there. It’s definitely a milestone even if it’s just 3ranks up as not so many could be prions of such. Congrats to have made it this far and you’re not quite far from your Full member rank either. Keep being encouraged in don’t defray from the goods your doing and could do on the forum.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Congratulations, are you sure you wrote all these posts from your phone? I tried to try it out in my alt account, but I found it difficult to write a line, let alone write several lines. Continue to work hard, and I am sure that you will get what you want, as your participation rate compared to merit points is high, but remember that the goal in the end is not just to join signature campaigns, because I have begun to see activity for new accounts in your local board.

comments.author: BITCOIN4X
comments.body: If you don't have any goals in this forum then I guarantee you will never be motivated to achieve anything. I truly believe that 99% of contributors really care about achievements regardless of rank or reputation, and to be honest that is something to be proud of.Especially for you, congratulations for anything that makes you proud even though some users may think it's not a big achievement that requires a thread for celebration. Something small can become big when you don't stop trying and keep trying your best to improve, so never give up and know that your journey is still very long.

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMThe journey of bitcointalk is a journey of gradual process, when you look around you will see that may has registered in the bitcointalk and their are unable I stand in this precious time to congratulate myself for achieving my first milestone despite that theirs many milestones to achieve but at least I have counted 1 and others shall be achieve later Congratulations on your new rank. It's not something easy, especially since you can get 61 merits with just 63 activities, it's really a good start and I'm sure you'll quickly get full member rank quickly. In the future, as suggested by other members, maybe you can post your achievements in @BitcoinGirl.Club thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472533.msg0#new

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I want to join in and encourage you too, OP. Your participation in the forum will soon be one year old. I respect you for your strength to use the forum from a mobile phone, since it is absolutely difficult for me to write a few lines on it. But you successfully create posts from your mobile, and sometimes they are rewarded with merit.I remember a person from your local board who desperately wanted to earn money for a new laptop; today, he is a legendary and well-known figure on the forum. I wish you the same success and hope you stay strong in your quest to learn Bitcoin and improve your life.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: Congratulations on becoming a member now, may this milestone encourage you to continue without giving up.While you can still do anything on the forum even though it can only be accessed via cellphone while many say making a single line post is difficult but you have made the effort even though you don't feel comfortable, but believe in the current achievement that keeps you excited and continues to continue other milestones.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMI stand in this precious time to congratulate myself for achieving my first milestone despite that theirs many milestones to achieve but at least I have counted 1 and others shall be achieve later The point is, anyone who comes to this forum has the opportunity and a good understanding of Bitcoin, as long as they are willing to learn and remain sure of what they want, Of course all of this will be easy to get, continue to contribute and understand crypto well for the community here.I'm sure the achievements you have now show that you have tried well. The posts, activities, merits you have show all that, with the remaining 38 achievements you have left, you can be full, I'm sure you can do and achieve all that, never give up on wanting to achieve something, remember to make history as other members here have done who have succeeded.

comments.body: Quote from: Riginac111 on November 02, 2023, 04:53:58 AMThe journey of bitcointalk is a journey of gradual process, when you look around you will see that may has registered in the bitcointalk and their are unable to achieve any milestone in bitcointalk because of challenges, I thank almighty for me to reach members rank after all challenges I faced both sickness and losing my phone, the one of losing my phone is the one that  would have discouraged me mostly from bitcointalk, but I insisted and continued using my sisters phone to login my account in forum Today I'm a member and I'm excited to see myself to this rank, I will stand to celebrate another milestone in the forum which I know very well,  so when I looked at my ranked up I get more courage, I want to everyone to not lose hope in what they are doing, because their is some things that will stand as obstacles when you want to know what you don't I stand in this precious time to congratulate myself for achieving my first milestone despite that theirs many milestones to achieve but at least I have counted 1 and others shall be achieve later Sometimes facing challenges depends on the actions you are taking while on the forum. As I see this is a ranked up post I would say that the challenges you speak of might be gaining merit. While I feel that users are sometimes overlooked when it comes to merit, I think for the most part those that put in actual effort are noticed. If you post mostly bounties, or i agree with blah blah posts, or other low quality activities you will not get many merits. A little bit of effort and a lot of reading will go a long way on this forum. Anyways, congrats on the member rank. Maybe the challenges won't be as bad on the full member journey.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Congratulations OP. We want other Nigerians to follow your footsteps. Patient is key.
